Description: Seven fragments (five of which are now joined together) of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior very worn, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of three lines of thickly black-painted hieratic text identifying contents.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 4 (but there without the small joining fragment)
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393163) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393163)
